results.title: The Flinders: ranges of legend
results.creator_credit: S A Government Tourist Bureau and G Shepherd
results.brief_description: The geological origin and the place of the Flinders Range in Aboriginal mythology. Shows rock paintings and carvings in the Wilpena area, the old mining town of Blinman and the ruins of Kanyaka.

results.title: The Flight of the snows
results.creator_credit: Donald Duprey, ONF | NFB, International Cinemedia Centre Ltd and Jean-Louis Frund
results.brief_description: The snow goose is a tightly scheduled bird. It winters in the United States, flies 4,000 kilometres to breed and raise a family in the high Arctic, and returns before the frost sets in. This film documents the formation-flying, feeding habits, rearing of young and lifestyle of the great snow goose. Written by Joseph Koenig; music by James Solkin; voice and narration by Bud Knapp.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Duprey, ONF | NFB, International Cinemedia Centre Ltd and Jean-Louis Frund

results.title: The Flight of the Snow Geese
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival Anglia Wildlife Series”.
This award winning film tells the story of 300,000 wild snow geese - and the fourteen snowgeese who thought they were human beings. One late spring, naturalist cameramen, Des and Jen Bartlett, marooned themselves on the rugged Arctic tundra for four months. Their objective, to cover for the first time the incredible migration story of the snow geese, from their arctic nesting grounds west of Hudson Bay, south to Texas and the Gulf of Mexico, (a 2,500 mile journey). Living in their tent among the geese, the Bartletts found themselves “leaders” of their own gaggle of strongly attached young geese who now had to make the journey with them. This beautiful film reveals the adventures of the wild geese and the orphans who eventually had to break with their human “parents” and find their way back into the wild. Rated: G

results.title: The Flight of the Gossamer Condor
results.creator_credit: Jacqueline Shedd, Shedd Productions and Ben Shedd
results.brief_description: The story of how Dr. Paul MacCready won the Kemer Prize for the first man-powered aircraft that could fly a mile long figure of eight course. Follows the inventor through twelve months of planning and disappointments as he develops his idea from the first crude wing into a sophisticated craft that flies the course.

results.title: The Flight of the dragon
results.creator_credit: Graham McInnes, ONF | NFB and Leslie Thatcher
results.brief_description: Bronzes of the Han and Wei dynasties, T’ang ceramics, Sung water colors and Buddhist frescoes of the Yuan all express in some way the Chinese philosophy of life. These glimpses of the art of China gives us some conception of this age-old civilisation. Dr. Liu Shih Shun, the then Chinese ambassador to Canada, narrates highlights in the history of the country, as a parade of her delicate masterpieces, drawn from the famous collection in the Royal Ontario Museum, passes before the camera.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham McInnes, ONF | NFB and Leslie Thatcher

results.title: The Flight of penguins
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Jacques Cousteau looks at the penguin colonies of the Antarctic, describing the evolution of penguins from birds to marine animals, their mating habits and care of the young.

results.title: The Flesh = La Carne
results.brief_description: A darkly comic look at the underbelly of sexual relationships from the director of the infamous and shocking “La Grande Bouffe”. Paolo is a divorced father of two who struggles to earn a living as a nightclub entertainer. His mundane life is turned upside-down when he falls madly in love with the voluptuous and sexually experienced Francesca. They embark on a passionate affair in which Paolo willingly becomes Francesca’s sex-slave. Things take a darker turn when Paolo’s desire become obsessive and threatens to consume them both. Cast includes Sergio Castellitto, Francesca Dellera and Philippe Leotard. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Fleeting image
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Deals with the work of Edward Muybridge in California and Etienne Jules Marey in Paris who were using photography to analyse human and animal movement in the 1870’s and 80’s. Their work led to the development of the cine-camera.

results.title: The Flatworms (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Modern Learning Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Shows planarian’s moving and detecting food; the taking of food into the branched intestine through a muscular pharynx. One animal is shown regenerating new parts. The microscope reveals tapeworms in a catfish. A living scolex is shown clinging to the intestinal wall. Several proglottids are shown in detail.

results.title: The Flame that freezes
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Electrolux absorption-type refrigerators in the company’s Melbourne factory. Compares old methods of food preservation with those using refrigeration principles. Shows the manufacture of the freezing unit and explains how it operates. Diagrams explain the operation of refrigerators using gas, kerosene and electricity. Summarises the uses of refrigeration in medical services in both city and country.
